comment.author: 53839824@N05
comment._content: Wouldn't it be more accurate to say the date is between ca. 1914 and ca. 1915? Was France at war before 1914?

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: kmsauter_14: Yes, as these depict the early days of WWI, a date of 1914 is more accurate.  We are going through these images of World War I and adding more specific dates and the name of the war. Thanks for helping out.

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: Same photo by Agence Meurisse on Gallica site, with caption: "A Soissons, bombardement par les Allemands : maisons en ruines" At Soissons, bombardment by the Germans: Houses in ruins gallica.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/btv1b90419477 Publication date: 1914

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: artolog:  Thank you for the matching photograph from the Gallica site.  We will add more details when we update.
